item.title: Tracey add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Tracey add a quote by William O. Douglas
item.description:
"Restriction of free thought and free speech is the most dangerous of all subversions. It is the one un-American act that could most easily defeat us."
[<i>The One Un-American Act</i>, Speech to the Author's Guild Council in New York, on receiving the 1951 Lauterbach Award (December 3, 1952)]" -- William O. Douglas

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Bob Marley
item.description: "Emancipate yourselves from mental slavery. None but ourselves can free our minds." -- Bob Marley

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Edward R. Murrow
item.description: "We must not confuse dissent with disloyalty. When the loyal opposition dies, I think the soul of America dies with it." -- Edward R. Murrow

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Evelyn Beatrice Hall
item.description: "I disapprove of what you say, but I will defend to the death your right to say it." -- Evelyn Beatrice Hall

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "The American way of life is not sustainable. It doesnâ€™t acknowledge that there is a world beyond America. " -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Arundhati Roy
item.description: "To love. To be loved. To never forget your own insignificance. To never get used to the unspeakable violence and the vulgar disparity of life around you. To seek joy in the saddest places. To pursue beauty to its lair. To never simplify what is complicated or complicate what is simple. To respect strength, never power. Above all, to watch. To try and understand. To never look away. And never, never to forget." -- Arundhati Roy

item.title: Tracey add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "If we don't believe in freedom of expression for people we despise, we don't believe in it at all." -- Noam Chomsky
